name: sean gonzalez
title: bud tender
coverLetter: Hello, my name is Sean (female;20) I've never worked for a medical shop before but I've seen how things work. I believe my postive attitude would be great for a job that requires interation with one.
experience:
Sean Gonzalez

6710 Stafford Ave Apt. A Huntington Park CA 90255

Phone: (323)896-5720 Email: sgonzalezdms@gmail.com

Objective:  To seek a challenging position where I can apply my experience and communication skills to further my goals in customer service.


Education: Montebello High School graduating class of 2016


Experience:

Cafe Sociedad Latina

My responsibilities working here were to maintain a positive attitude and provide the best customer service. I worked as a cashier and kept my working space clean. Working as a cashier allowed me to build up my people skills as well as being able to multitask. I prepared coffees, frappes, smoothies, and fruit cups as well as prepping the fruit.

Sushi Lounge

   Working here allowed me to gain experience in reservation making and to better my communication skills I was a hostess here and enjoyed my position but I moved out of the city. Being a hostess allowed me to build up my communication skills and helped me manage large groups of people. Also working as a hostess allowed me to work under very stressful situations, in which I had to think not only quickly, but efficiently.

Little Jewels of New Orleans

Working here allowed me to perform physically demanding tasks in order to keep the store well maintained, stocked, and clean. as well as work in the front calling out orders for the customers.

Blush Boutique

Working here made me get more comfortable with speaking and giving women tips on how to dress. The women appreciate my tips on what and what not to match, and simply looking for what they are asking for, all in a positive attitude.

Volunteer Experience:

Dolores Mission

I volunteered here for 4 consecutive years; feeding the homeless.    I gained communication skills and learned about people's lives and got to work with food as well.

Camp Round Meadow

I was a counselor in charge of a group of 10 year old girls for a week in Big Bear. I learned how to be more understanding and a leader.


Summary of Qualification:

   I work well under pressure and can multitask. Great communication and customer service due to work and volunteer experience. I have received my Food Handlers card as well. Having moved from San Diego to Los Angeles has broadened my experience when it comes to working and adapting with a multitude of people.
